radiographic_examinations.findings: The lung bases are notable for a 3mm nodule in the left lower lobe, minimal bibasilar atelectasis, a dilated appendix measuring up to 13 mm containing an appendicolith at its base, fluid filled with surrounding inflammatory stranding, normal liver, spleen, adrenals, pancreas, gallbladder, kidneys with symmetric contrast enhancement, no intraperitoneal free fluid or free air, and normal aorta without retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
